glossdef.p: An interactive TV technology that allows subscribers to view programming in real time or download programs and view them later.
Programming viewed at a time selected by the subscriber (on an STB or OTTdevice) into which an addressable ad (VOD asset) can be inserted.
STB configuration data defining the household tag markers to assign to the STB.
See household tag.

glossentry.glossdef: Protocol used for monitoring the state of network devices.

glossdef.p: A communication channel used by SeaChange ad inserters allowing the BDSto perform asset checks on the inserter, and also for the MVPDto send virtual schedules to the ad inserter.
This message is part of the SCTE 130 standard and is a notification of whether an ad was successfully played.

glossentry.glossdef: Protocol used to communicate across the Web Services interface for the BDMS, Advatar Adapter, and third-party servers.
See Zone Target Area.

glossdef.p: An Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) standard specification that uses an XML template which allows video content owners to describe the structure for ad inventory insertion when they don’t control the video player or the content distribution outlet.

It is different from Video Ad Serving Template (VAST), which contains ad pods that allow ad slots to be inserted into videos, but VAST does not allow content owners to define the ad breaks or the timing of the ad breaks.
VMAP was designed to be used in conjunction with VAST and is well-suited for video content creators who have no control over the video player, but want to control the ad experience within the videos.

glossentry.glossdef: Advatar Adapter function responsible for managing the communication from the STBs to the Adapter or a third party.
See Single Advertiser Spot Optimization.
See digital video recorder.

glossdef.p: An XML-based protocol developed by the Interactive Advertising Bureau (IAB) that standardizes the delivery of targeted advertising to IP-addressable devices. The schema defines the data structure of files communicated between ad servers and video clients, and enables device-agnostic ad delivery, playback, and tracking.

glossentry.glossdef: Period of time during which a cue message for a break is expected to occur. This cue indicates there is an upcoming break.
See placement status notification.

Request sent upstream from the Advatar STB application to the Advatar Adapter to request a selected list of assets. In a production system, the results from the voting process are factored into the construction of the viewlists.
See set-top box.

glossdef.p:
INVIDI application existing inside of the STB. The ADE defines and delivers the ad play requests to the STB based on:
Household characteristics assigned to the STB
Orderline information ( ADRs)
Overall ad importance
The ADE creates either the path from the viewlist (IC) or a playlist from the break descriptor (DVR).
For DVR-based ad delivery in Aggregation, the ADE further defines which ads are stored based on BDMSad importance ( CPM/ value, order priority, order type priority, and client priority).

glossentry.glossdef: Message used for communicating between SNMP-enableddevices, often used for monitoring devices and networks.
See out-of-band.

glossdef.p: A request sent to the BDMSfrom an ADMto generate a ZTAorder.

List of all ADRsavailable for a specific break, including the relative time in the break that they may play. Each STB examines the viewlist to determine which addressable ad to play at each time offset in the break.

glossentry.glossdef: Area defined by the MVPDin which all of the STBs receive the same content for a given network stream. The Advatar system is then used to manage what type of addressable ad content is delivered to each of these areas.

glossdef.p: An STB that has the INVIDI STB client loaded and is sending messages to the Advatar Adapter; however, is not included in the list of STBs in the BDMSdatabase.

glossentry.glossdef: See required content notification.

glossdef.p: An addressable ad that is inserted into streamed or previously downloaded programming ( VOD content).

glossentry.glossdef: Advatar component responsible for managing the SOAP interface between the BDMSand the Advatar Adapter, as well as any external SOAP interfaces.
Configured period of time when the STBs should or should not send their data back to the Advatar Adapter. Used for reserving bandwidth for non-critical times.
See Coordinated Universal Time.
See Video Multiple Ad Playlist.
See Simple Network Management Protocol.

A virtual zone that can be used to define a subset of viewers from a larger physical zone. Each virtual zone receives scheduling per network that defines the insertion opportunities for that virtual zone.
See .

glossdef.p: A device that receives and decodes digital television signals and other data for display on a subscriber television set.

glossentry.glossdef: Device or software that records video in a digital format to a disk drive. In an Advatar system this refers to the DVR function of the STB.

The POIS is a repository of information on placement opportunities within both Live/Linear and VODcontent. May also contain additional information such as ownership rights. Placement opportunities are breaks available for inserting ads.

glossdef.p: The primary time standard by which the world references 24-hour clock time and date. Not to be confused with Greenwich Mean Time (GMT), which is a time zone that jumps ahead one hour in the spring and back in the fall. UTC is not a time zone and does not observe any type of daylight saving time change. Computer operating systems such as Windows and Linux use UTC as their worldwide time reference, as does SQL Server.
A low-bandwidth one-way communication channel from the Adapter ( DSS) to the STBs, used to deliver targeting, ADR, and global configuration data.

glossentry.glossdef: A span of time, for example, two minutes, set aside by the network for a local operator when a commercial break occurs on the network channel. Breaks can consist of multiple avails and are triggered by one SCTE cue.

Discrete marketing characteristics typically imported from an external data source and assigned to relevant STBs running the Advatar application. Used to group households into different behavioral categories and assign metadata descriptors.

glossdef.p: A server or group of servers consisting of the DSS, BDS, and RCS.

glossentry.glossdef: The number of seconds into the break at which the ad begins to play.
See video on demand.
The AMCcomponent responsible for scheduling and running tasks (jobs).

glossdef.p: Addressable ad delivery mode in which alternative addressable ads are delivered at the same time as a default ad that is scheduled through the traffic and billing system. The default ad and all alternative ads are owned by a single advertiser.

glossentry.glossdef: See Simple Object Access Protocol.

glossdef.p: A period of time in a schedule during which ad insertion opportunities are not scheduled based on time; usually limited to live events. The window may span two or more breaks throughout the entire program. For these events, the timing for the breaks is based on the order in which the breaks are received from the start of the window.

glossentry.glossdef: Viewlists and break descriptors that were created but never played because matching cue tones were not received or because the Advatar insertion channels were already allocated to play addressable ads for other networks.

glossdef.p: An interactive TV technology that allows subscribers to view programming in real time or download programs and view them later.
Programming viewed at a time selected by the subscriber (on an STB or OTTdevice) into which an addressable ad (VOD asset) can be inserted.
STB configuration data defining the household tag markers to assign to the STB.
See household tag.

glossentry.glossdef: Protocol used for monitoring the state of network devices.

This message is part of the SCTE 130 standard and is a notification of whether an ad was successfully played.
